meanings.definition: Not willing to change or be influenced
meanings.sent1: She was unamenable to trying new foods, always sticking to her usual meals.
meanings.sent2: The cat was unamenable to wearing the cute bow tie its owner bought.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn old donkey was unamenable to taking a break from carrying heavy loads.
meanings.sent4: His mind was unamenable to the idea of giving up his dream of becoming an astronaut.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree stood unamenable to the strong winds, rooted firmly in the ground.

meanings.definition: Not responsive to authority or control
meanings.sent1: The rebellious teenager was unamenable to following curfew rules.
meanings.sent2: The wild horse was unamenable to being tamed by any trainer.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey was unamenable to staying inside its cage.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit was unamenable to the restrictions imposed by society.
meanings.sent5: The fierce storm was unamenable to the attempts to calm it down.

meanings.definition: Not capable of being persuaded or convinced
meanings.sent1: His fixed beliefs made him unamenable to considering alternative viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: The stone-faced judge was unamenable to the defendant's emotional plea.
meanings.sent3: The old computer was unamenable to accepting the new software updates.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was unamenable to the sweet words of flattery.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were unamenable to revealing their secrets to the archaeologists.
